citation.article-title: Puniceicoccus vermicola gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine bacterium, and description of Puniceicoccaceae fam. nov., Puniceicoccales ord. nov., Opitutaceae fam. nov., Opitutales ord. nov. and Opitutae classis nov. in the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia'
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Puniceicoccus (Pu.ni.cei.coc′cus. L. adj. puniceus pinkish red; N.L. masc. n. coccus from Gr. masc. n. kokkos a berry; N.L. masc. n. Puniceicoccus a pinkish-red-coloured coccus).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, facultatively anaerobic cocci (oval-shaped, 0.6–1.0 μm in diameter).
The predominant fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and C18 : 0.
The only respiratory quinone detected is menaquinone-7.
The DNA G+C content is 52.1±0.5 mol%.
The type and only species of the genus is Puniceicoccus vermicola.
